intro: Spermacoce scandens, commonly known as the climbing randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its small, white to pink flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom throughout the growing season. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds.
